result.execSummary:
The defendant Abraham Avina Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Abraham Avina Ramirez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Abraham Avina Ramirez was found guilty of Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-3RD Offense, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges  for work and treatment.
Court ordered any vehicle owned, operated and titled in the defendant's name to be equipped with the ignition interlock device for 24 months.
AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.

Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge by 4/3/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay a fine of $600.00.
Pay the fine and all fees and surcharges by 4/3/2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

*No driving without a valid license.

charges.descr: Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-3RD Offense
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abraham Avina Ramirez

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.  rmm

Defendant Abraham Avina Ramirez in court.  Attorney Matt Last in court for Abraham Avina Ramirez.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Sworn as Interpreter:  Liesl Monroy.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNTS 2, 3 AND 4:  Pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered charges dismissed.
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 4 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment. 

- Pay a fine of $600.00.
- Court ordered defendants operation privileges revoked for 24 MONTHS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.
- Court ordered any vehicle owned,operated and titled in the defendant's name to be equipped with the ignition interlock device for 24 MONTHS.
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.
- No driving without a valid license.

- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge by 4/03/23.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay the fine and ALL fees and surcharges by 4/03/23. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, filed.  rmm

Defendant Abraham Avina Ramirez in court with attorney Matt Last.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Abraham Avina Ramirez in court with attorney Matt Last.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel asks for an adjournment. Case adjourned to Br 01.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Abraham Avina Ramirez in court with attorney Matt Last.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Interpreter waived by the defense.  Atty. Last requests another status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Abraham Avina Ramirez in court with attorney Matt Last.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Last has just received discovery and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 032255,
Payable Number: 997513,
Receipt Number: 22RP013720,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Abraham Avina Ramirez in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Abraham Avina Ramirez in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Abraham Avina Ramirez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
